sen.j: 梅 謙次郎（うめ けんじろう、1860年7月24日（万延元年6月7日 (旧暦)） - 1910年（明治43年）8月26日）は、日本の法学者。
sen.e: Kenjiro UME (July 24, 1860 - August 26, 1910) was a Japanese jurist.
Kenjiro UME (July 24, 1860 - August 26, 1910) was a Japanese jurist.
Kenjiro UME (July 24, 1860 - August 26, 1910) was a Japanese jurist.

sen.j: 1910年8月25日、勲一等瑞宝章受章。
sen.e: On August 25, 1910, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
On August 25, 1910, he was conferred the Decoration of Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
sen.cmt: awarded→conferred と修正しました。 Decoration of を補いました。
sen.e: On August 25, 1910, he was conferred the Decoration of Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: フランス及びドイツへ留学し、その博士論文『和解論』は現地でも高く評価される。
sen.e: He studied in France and Germany, and his doctoral thesis written in French 'De la transaction' (Japanese title: Wakairon) was highly evaluated even in France.
sen.cmt: 和解論→ 'De la transaction' (Japanese title: Wakairon) としました。[www.hosei.ac.jp/hosei/gaiyo/daigaku_shi/umesori.html]
sen.e: He studied in France and Germany, and his doctoral thesis written in French "De la transaction" (Japanese title: Wakairon) was highly evaluated even by locals.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。in France→by locals と修正しました。（この場合、”現地でも”としかないので）
sen.e: He studied in France and Germany, and his doctoral thesis written in French "De la transaction" (Japanese title: Wakairon) was highly evaluated even by locals.

sen.j: 穂積陳重、富井政章とともに、日本の民法を起草した3人のうちの一人で、商法の起草にも参加。
sen.e: He was one of the three scholars who drew up the Japanese Civil Code, together with Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and he was also a drafting member of the Commercial Code.
He was one of the three scholars who drew up the Japanese Civil Code, together with Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and he was also a drafting member of the Commercial Code.
He was one of the three scholars who drew up the Japanese Civil Code, together with Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and he was also a drafting member of the Commercial Code.

sen.j: さらには韓国の法典起草にまで加わっている。
sen.e: In addition, he also participated in writing the draft of the Korean legal codes.
sen.cmt: 韓国の→Korean （1950年の南北分断前なので韓国→Korean としました。）
sen.e: In addition, he also participated in writing the draft of the Korean legal codes.
In addition, he also participated in writing the draft of the Korean legal codes.

sen.j: これら多大な功績から梅は「日本民法学の父」といわれる。
sen.e: Because of these significant achievements, Ume is called 'the father of Japanese Civil Code.'
Because of these significant achievements, Ume is called 'the father of Japanese Civil Code.'
Because of these significant achievements, Ume is called 'the father of Japanese Civil Code.'

sen.j: 法政大学設立にも貢献。
sen.e: He also contributed to the establishment of Hosei University.
He also contributed to the establishment of Hosei University.
He also contributed to the establishment of Hosei University.

tit.e: Dr. Ume is a real Benkei (tough man)'
Dr. Ume is a real Benkei (tough man)'
tit.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
tit.e: Dr. Ume is a real Benkei (tough man)'

sen.j: 穂積陳重の『法窓夜話』によると、梅謙次郎は、鋭敏な頭脳を持ち、法文の起草をするのが非常に迅速で、起草委員会では、他の委員である穂積陳重、富井政章の二人の批評を虚心に聞き容れ、自説を改めた。
sen.e: According to "Hoso Yawa" (a night talk about the legal circle) written by Nobushige HOZUMI, Kenjiro Ume had a clear head and he drew up the draft of the code very quickly, and in addition, he was ready to listen to the other two members of the drafting committee, Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and accepted their criticisms with open mind, even willing to change his own idea.
sen.cmt: 『法窓夜話』→定訳不明："Hoso Yawa" (a night talk about the legal circle)としました。
sen.e: According to "Hoso Yawa" (a night talk about the legal circle) written by Nobushige HOZUMI, Kenjiro UME had a clear head and he drew up the draft of the code very quickly, and in addition, he was ready to listen to the other two members of the drafting committee, Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and accepted their criticisms with open mind, even willing to change his own idea.

According to "Hoso Yawa" (a night talk about the legal circle) written by Nobushige HOZUMI, Kenjiro UME had a clear head and he drew up the draft of the code very quickly, and in addition, he was ready to listen to the other two members of the drafting committee, Nobushige HOZUMI and Masaakira TOMII, and accepted their criticisms with open mind, even willing to change his own idea.

sen.j: しかし、一たび起草委員会としての案が決まると、法典調査会での議論においては、勇健な弁舌で反駁、弁解に努め、原案の維持を図った。
sen.e: However, once he make out a draft as the final plan of the drafting committee, he obstinately maintained the original plan during the discussions held in the Investigation Committee of Codes, making bold and eloquent counterarguments and persuasive explanations.

However, once he made out a draft as the final plan of the drafting committee, he obstinately maintained the original plan during the discussions held in the Investigation Committee of Codes, making bold and eloquent counterarguments and persuasive explanations.

However, once he made out a draft as the final plan of the drafting committee, he obstinately maintained the original plan during the discussions held in the Investigation Committee of Codes, making bold and eloquent counterarguments and persuasive explanations.

sen.j: これに対し、富井政章は、法文を沈思熟考の上起草し、起草委員会の三人の議論では、容易に自説を改めなかった。
sen.e: On the other hand, Masaakira TOMII dedicated himself to write up the text of the code after a thorough deliberation and he did not easily accept the arguments against his idea during the discussion between these three members of the drafting committee.

On the other hand, Masaakira TOMII dedicated himself to write up the text of the code after a thorough deliberation and he did not easily accept the arguments against his idea during the discussion between these three members of the drafting committee.

On the other hand, Masaakira TOMII dedicated himself to write up the text of the code after a thorough deliberation and he did not easily accept the arguments against his idea during the discussion between these three members of the drafting committee.

sen.j: しかし、法典調査会では、反対論を受け容れる姿勢を示した。
sen.e: However, he was flexible about the opposite views proposed in the Investigation Committee of Codes.
However, he was tolerated towards the opposite views proposed in the Investigation Committee of Codes.
sen.cmt: flexible about→tolerated towards と修正しました。
sen.e: However, he was tolerated towards the opposite views proposed in the Investigation Committee of Codes.

sen.j: それぞれ、一理あるとの理解を示しつつ、梅謙次郎の外弁慶と富井政章の内弁慶ぶりが対照的だったと回顧している。
sen.e: Hozumi looked back on that time and commented that they showed contrasting characters, as Masaakira TOMII was Uchi-Benkei (tough on his own turf), while Kenjiro UME was Soto-Benkei (tough on the other's turf), although Hozumi thought that each of the two had a point.
sen.cmt: 外弁慶→定訳不明：Soto-Benkei (tough on the other's turf)、「内弁慶→Uchi-Benkei (tough on his own turf)」に合わせました。内弁慶→Uchi-Benkei (tough on his own turf)としました。
sen.e: Hozumi looked back on that time and commented that they showed contrasting characters, as Masaakira TOMII was uchibenkei (bossy at home, submissive outside), while Kenjiro UME was sotobenkei (arrogant outside, timid at home), although Hozumi thought that each of the two had a point.
sen.cmt: 外弁慶：sotobenkei (arrogant outside, timid at home).内弁慶：uchibenkei (bossy at home, submissive outside) と修正しました。なお、ここでの”一理あるとの理解を示しつつ”の、理解を示したのが穂積であったのか、これらの二人がお互いについてのものであったのが明らかでありませんが、ここではこのままにしております。
sen.e: Hozumi looked back on that time and commented that they showed contrasting characters, as Masaakira TOMII was uchibenkei (bossy at home, submissive outside), while Kenjiro UME was sotobenkei (arrogant outside, timid at home), although Hozumi thought that each of the two had a point.

sen.j: 松江藩（現･島根県松江市）で藩医の次男として生まれ、島根県立松江北高等学校などを経て東京外国語学校 (旧制)（現東京外国語大学）仏語科を首席で卒業
sen.e: He was born as the second son of a doctor working at a public clinic in the Matsue Domain (present Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture), and after studying at Shimane Prefectural Matsue Kohoku Senior High School and others, he graduated from the department of French Language of Tokyo School of Foreign Language (of the old system) (present Tokyo University of Foreign Studies) at the top of the class.

He was born as the second son of a doctor working at a public clinic in the Matsue Domain (present Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture), and after studying at Shimane Prefectural Matsue Kita Senior High School and others, he graduated from the department of French Language of Tokyo School of Foreign Language (of the old system) (present Tokyo University of Foreign Studies) at the top of the class.
sen.cmt: 「島根県立松江北高等学校」を修正しました。（まつえこうほく→まつえきた）と修正しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of a doctor working at a public clinic in the Matsue Domain (present Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture), and after studying at Shimane Prefectural Matsue Kita Senior High School and others, he graduated from the department of French Language of Tokyo School of Foreign Language (of the old system) (present Tokyo University of Foreign Studies) at the top of the class.

sen.j: 1884年 司法省法学校を首席で卒業（第2期生）
sen.e: In 1884, he graduated from Shihosho Hogakko (a low school affiliated to the Ministry of Justice, which was later absorbed into The University of Tokyo) at the top of the class (the second class of the graduates).
sen.cmt: 第2期生→定訳不明：the second class of the graduatesとしました。
sen.e: In 1884, he graduated from Shihosho Hogakko (a low school affiliated to the Ministry of Justice, which was later absorbed into The University of Tokyo) at the top of the class (the second year of graduation from it).
sen.cmt: 「第二期生」は"the second year of graduation from it" と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1884, he graduated from Shihosho Hogakko (a low school affiliated to the Ministry of Justice, which was later absorbed into The University of Tokyo) at the top of the class (the second year of graduation from it).

sen.j: 1889年 フランス・リヨン大学で博士号を取得し、リヨンからヴェルメイユ賞碑を受ける
sen.e: In 1889, he finished a doctorate at University of Lyon, France, and he was awarded Vermeil Medal from Lyon City.
sen.cmt: ヴェルメイユ賞碑→定訳不明：Vermeil Medal としました。
sen.e: In 1889, he finished a doctorate at University of Lyon, France, and he was awarded Vermeil Medal (Medaille de Vermail) from Lyon City.
sen.cmt: 「ヴェルメイユ賞碑」は"Medaille de Vermail"のことだと思います。Vermeil Medal (Medaille de Vermail) と補いました。
sen.e: In 1889, he finished a doctorate at University of Lyon, France, and he was awarded Vermeil Medal (Medaille de Vermail) from Lyon City.

sen.j: 1891年 博士 (法学)
sen.e: In 1891, he earned a PhD in law (docteur en droit).
In 1891, he earned PhD in law (Docteur en Droit).
sen.cmt: a を削除しました。カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1891, he earned PhD in law (Docteur en Droit).

sen.j: 1894年 東京法学校（現 法政大学）教員、リヨン大学やベルリン大学留学
sen.e: In 1894, he became a teacher at Tokyo Law School (present Hosei University) and studied abroad at University of Lyon and Humboldt University of Berlin.
In 1894, he became a teacher at Tokyo Law School (present Hosei University), and studied abroad at University of Lyon and Humboldt University of Berlin.
In 1894, he became a teacher at Tokyo Law School (present Hosei University), and studied abroad at University of Lyon and Humboldt University of Berlin.

sen.j: 1890年 帝国大学法科大学（現 東京大学法学部）教授。
sen.e: In 1890, he became a professor at Imperial University School of Law (present Faculty of Law at The University of Tokyo).
In 1890, he became a professor at Imperial University School of Law (present Faculty of Law at The University of Tokyo).
In 1890, he became a professor at Imperial University School of Law (present Faculty of Law at The University of Tokyo).

sen.j: 農商務省 (日本)参事官兼務等を歴任
sen.e: He additionally held various important posts such as the councilor at the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan).
He successively held various important posts such as the councilor at the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan).
He successively held various important posts such as the councilor at the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan).

sen.j: 1897年 東京帝国大学法科大学長兼内閣法制局長官兼内閣恩給局。
sen.e: In 1897, he became the president of Tokyo Imperial University, School of Law, and in parallel with this, he took up additional posts as the director of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau and the Cabinet Pension Bureau.
sen.cmt: 法制局→Cabinet Legislation Bureauとしました。長官→director としました。内閣恩給局→ Cabinet Pension Bureauとしました。
sen.e: In 1897, he became the president of Tokyo Imperial University, School of Law, and in parallel with this, he took up additional posts as the director of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau and the Cabinet Pension Bureau.

In 1897, he became the president of Tokyo Imperial University, School of Law, and in parallel with this, he took up additional posts as the director of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau and the Cabinet Pension Bureau.

sen.j: 1899年 財団法人和仏法律学校（現法政大学）校長
sen.e: In 1899, he became the principal of Japanese-French Law School Foundation (present Hosei University).
In 1899, he became the principal of the Japanese-French Law School Foundation (present Hosei University).
In 1899, he became the principal of the Japanese-French Law School Foundation (present Hosei University).

sen.j: 1900年 文部省総務長官
sen.e: In 1900, he became the director general of the Ministry of Education.
In 1900, he became the director general of the Ministry of Education.
In 1900, he became the director general of the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 1901年 東京帝国大学法科大学教授
sen.e: In 1901, he took up the post of the professor at School of Law, Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1901, he took up the post of the professor at the School of Law, Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1901, he took up the post of the professor at the School of Law, Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: 1903年から1910年まで法政大学総理
sen.e: From 1903 to 1910, he assumed the presidency of Hosei University.
From 1903 to 1910, he assumed the presidency of Hosei University.
From 1903 to 1910, he assumed the presidency of Hosei University.

sen.j: 1906年 韓国統監だった伊藤博文に請われ韓国政府法律最高顧問に就任、法典編纂に携わる
sen.e: In 1906, invited by Hirobumi ITO, who was Kankoku Tokan (inspector general of Korean Protection Agency; an agency established by the Japanese government to control Korea), he assumed the position of the judicial supreme adviser to the Korean government, and he took part in the compilation of the country's legal codes.
sen.cmt: 韓国政府→the Korean governmentとしました。（1950年の南北分断前なので韓国→Korean としました。）
sen.e: In 1906, invited by Hirobumi ITO, who was Kankoku Tokan (inspector general of Korean Protection Agency; an agency established by the Japanese government to control Korea), he assumed the position of the judicial supreme adviser to the Korean government, and he took part in the compilation of the country's legal codes.

In 1906, invited by Hirobumi ITO, who was Kankoku Tokan (inspector general of Korean Protection Agency; an agency established by the Japanese government to control Korea), he assumed the position of the judicial supreme adviser to the Korean government, and he took part in the compilation of the country's legal codes.

sen.j: 1910年 京城で腸チフスにより急逝、享年51。
sen.e: In 1910, he suddenly died from typhoid at the age of 51 in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule).
In 1910, he suddenly died from typhoid at the age of 51 in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule).
In 1910, he suddenly died from typhoid at the age of 51 in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule).

sen.j: 墓は護国寺にある
sen.e: His grave is located in Gokoku-ji Temple (Tokyo).
His grave is located in Gokoku-ji Temple.
His grave is located in Gokoku-ji Temple.

tit.j: 東川徳治（著）『博士梅謙次郎』（大空社、1997年）ISBN 9784756804853
